messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] make it rain
messages.msgSnippet:
Thank you Tami, I checked them out and they are great! BTW, got your daughters letter, Tehila will respond, well, she is three
hopefully soon! ... From:
messages.messageBody:
Thank you Tami,
I checked them out and they are great!
BTW, got your daughters letter, Tehila will respond, well, she is three
hopefully soon!





-------Original Message-------

From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, November 26, 2002 11:13:56 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] make it rain

Hi Rachel Ann,

Here is a pretty neat link.
WEATHER EXPERIMENTS

http://dcrafts.com/weatherexperiments.htm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Early Elementary Activities

http://www.reachoutmichigan.org/funexperiments/quick/earlyelem.html

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Hope that helps : )

Indiana Tami
----- Original Message -----
From: "Rachel Ann" <hindar@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, November 26, 2002 9:50 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] make it rain



Hi everyone,

Does anyone have a *recipe* for making rain in a bottle.
I know there is one somewhere, I just can't find it now.



-------Original Message-------

From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, November 26, 2002 9:31:28 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] HESFES

I'm also trying to figure it out, I'm wondering if I don't camp in a tent am
I going to be really far removed from the rest of the group? We are checking
into those trailer/type campers, pretty reasonably priced. But I love the
campfires and all that stuff,,,so,,,hmm


I don't know about trying to lug a tent through airports! I know my dh doesn
t think that sounds very fun. And he'd probably be the one carrying it.

Brenda, what type of sleeping accomodations are you considering?

Shyrley, you bring a tent from the US?

Is anyone else out there thinking about going over? From the states? It is
very reasonably priced, airfare, in May, to England is pretty resonable, I
know, tho' , it still is several hundred dollars for five of us so, I do
have to add it all up. My in-laws might want to go over too, so that would
be fun too.

Anyway, again I'm rambling to 900 people, sorry!

Kelli
Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...> wrote:11/25/02 22:12:

> Hesfes itself is pretty cheap. £34 for adults and £25 for kids. Thats
> for the whole week.
> What costs is the flights and the car hire.
> Virgin have some good deals on for London.
>
> Shyrley

I'm planning to go, but I can't imagine that I'll drive, since it's a fair
distance from Germany. Maybe we could rent a car together, if it's a decent
sized one. There's only 2 of us, my dh never gets to go anywhere fun.

There's also decent train service in England, isn't there, Shyrley? Any
chance of getting there by train, or do we need a car while there.

brenda
